channel.title: Client problems
channel.description:
I log in and it's perfect, no errors or anything, but then I add a model. Say example 50570.dat to the raw folder in my client folder and I go to log in and it says server offline, try every 2 hours.
Even when I add the model and ints

item.title: Client problems
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

AtomicInt_:

You will have to expand the model limit by adding onto the array, or you might potentially have a model made for a higher revision header.

If it’s the first issue I stated, then it’s self explanatory (I’m assuming you know how to do it)
Second choice, you would need to find a different model for your model header or add the model header that it was made for.

Read full topic

item.title: Client problems
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

So how do I fix this?

Read full topic

item.title: Client problems
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Because you’re attempting to set the model to the opcode of your “lime whip”, but it doesn’t exist, is corrupt, or what I stated before.

Read full topic

item.title: Client problems
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

Thank you guys.

But also, when I tried adding a lime whip, just the ints, it did the same thing, after I added the code I couldn’t log in.

Read full topic

item.title: Client problems
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You will have to expand the model limit by adding onto the array, or you might potentially have a model made for a higher revision header.

Read full topic

item.title: Client problems
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Models don’t normally support a number that high as their ID, try changing where that model ID is to something under 20000, which would be in the ints and the model itself

Read full topic
